title: White equipment

properties.name: description
properties.value: White Knight equipment (also known as white equipment) is a group of weapons and armour used by the White Knights. As their name suggests, the equipment is white in colour. To wield White Knight equipment the player must have completed the Wanted! quest, and have at least 10 Attack to wield weapons and 10 Defence to wear armour. White equipment offers the same bonuses as black weapons and black armour, except for a slightly higher Prayer bonus. Due to the difficulty of obtaining it compared to its stats, is mostly worn for appearance rather than use in combat.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:White equipment
A player with white armour equipped.
White equipment.

White Knight equipment (also known as white equipment) is a group of weapons and armour used by the White Knights. As their name suggests, the equipment is white in colour. To wield White Knight equipment the player must have completed the Wanted! quest, and have at least 10 Attack to wield weapons and 10 Defence to wear armour. White equipment offers the same bonuses as black weapons and black armour, except for a slightly higher Prayer bonus. Due to the difficulty of obtaining it compared to its stats, is mostly worn for appearance rather than use in combat.

A White 2h sword must be bought from Sir Vyvin in order to complete the Elite Falador Diary. Talking to Sir Vyvin while wearing a White platebody and White platelegs is a potential cryptic clue for master clues.

Like Black equipment, White equipment cannot be smithed.

The armour can be stored in the armour case of a player-owned house costume room.

Contents

  • 1 Information
  • 2 Strategy
  • 3 Knight rankings
  • 4 Weapons
    • 4.1 One-handed melee weapons
    • 4.2 Two-handed melee weapons
    • 4.3 Magic weapons
  • 5 Armour
  • 6 References

Information[edit | edit source]

To obtain White Knight equipment, a player can either buy items from Sir Vyvin (after completion of Wanted!) in the Falador Castle or trade with another player. However, buying white equipment from Sir Vyvin will depend on your White Knight ranking.

Strategy[edit | edit source]

An optimal location for killing black knights is in the southern portion of Taverley Dungeon.

A good location to kill black knights is in the southern portion of Taverley Dungeon. The area is single-way combat, however, cannons may attack multiple NPCs, provided the owner is not being attacked, making safespots useful for higher damage output.

Players should bring the most accurate gear they have, and a cannon. Place the cannon just north of the table in the middle of the room. Hide between the chairs on the eastern side of the table, where most of the black knights will not be able to reach, and will quickly die from the cannon.

Another option is the black knights located north of Venenatis in level 32 wilderness. With the wilderness slayer update, additional spawns were created. The area is multi-combat allowing for cannoning without the use of a safe spot. The black knights will also be aggressive regardless of player level due to their location in the wilderness.

If a player doesn't have access to or resources for use of a cannon, another option is the Black Knights' Fortress where two black knights spawn right next to an altar to recharge prayer.

Players can check their black knight kill count by opening the Wanted! page on the quest list in-game.

Killing the Black Knight imprisoned in the Port Sarim Jail will not contribute to a player's White Knight rank.

Knight rankings[edit | edit source]

In order to increase your ranking and unlock equipment items, you must kill a certain number of Black Knights. The kills start being tracked after being deputised as a White Knight during the Wanted! quest, and 100 kills are received as a bonus for completing the quest.[1] Killing White Knights decreases the player's ranking by 1 per knight killed.

Rank Kills needed Unlocks
Novice 100 White chainbody • White platelegs
Peon 200 White dagger • White sword
Page 300 White med helm • White plateskirt • White sq shield
Noble 500 White mace • White magic staff • White longsword
Adept 800 White full helm • White platebody • White kiteshield • White boots • White gloves
Master 1300 White 2h sword • White halberd • White scimitar • White warhammer • White battleaxe • White claws

Weapons[edit | edit source]

White weapons require an Attack level of 10 to wield, with the exception of the white warhammer, which instead requires 10 Strength.

And you get a +100 bonus on it at the end of the quest."

rawContent:
{{external|rs}}
[[File:White armour set (lg) equipped.png|thumb|130px|A player with white armour equipped.]]
[[File:White Knight Master Armoury.png|right|thumb|300px|White equipment.]]
'''White Knight equipment''' (also known as '''white equipment''') is a group of [[weapons]] and [[armour]] used by the [[White Knights]]. As their name suggests, the equipment is white in colour. To wield [[White Knight]] equipment the player must have completed the [[Wanted!]] [[quest]], and have at least 10 [[Attack]] to wield weapons and 10 [[Defence]] to wear armour. White equipment offers the same bonuses as black weapons and black armour, except for a slightly higher Prayer bonus. Due to the difficulty of obtaining it compared to its stats, is mostly worn for appearance rather than use in combat.

A [[White 2h sword]] must be bought from [[Sir Vyvin]] in order to complete the [[Falador Diary#Elite|Elite Falador Diary]]. Talking to Sir Vyvin while wearing a [[White platebody]] and [[White platelegs]] is a potential cryptic clue for [[Clue scroll (master)|master clues]].

Like [[Black equipment]], White equipment '''cannot''' be [[Smithing|smithed]].

The armour can be stored in the [[armour case]] of a [[player-owned house]] costume room.

==Information==
To obtain White Knight equipment, a player can either buy items from [[Sir Vyvin]] (after completion of [[Wanted!]]) in the [[Falador]] Castle or trade with another player. However, buying white equipment from Sir Vyvin will depend on your White Knight ranking.

==Strategy==
[[File:Cannon_placement_killing_black_knights.png|thumb|250px|An optimal location for killing black knights is in the southern portion of Taverley Dungeon.]]
A good location to kill black knights is in the southern portion of [[Taverley Dungeon]]. The area is single-way combat, however, cannons may attack multiple NPCs, provided the owner is not being attacked, making safespots useful for higher damage output.

Players should bring the most accurate gear they have, and a cannon. Place the cannon just north of the table in the middle of the room. Hide between the chairs on the eastern side of the table, where most of the black knights will not be able to reach, and will quickly die from the cannon.

Another option is the black knights located north of [[Venenatis]] in level 32 wilderness. With the wilderness slayer update, additional spawns were created. The area is multi-combat allowing for cannoning without the use of a safe spot. The black knights will also be aggressive regardless of player level due to their location in the wilderness.

If a player doesn't have access to or resources for use of a cannon, another option is the [[Black Knights' Fortress (location)|Black Knights' Fortress]] where two black knights spawn right next to an altar to recharge prayer. 

Players can check their black knight kill count by opening the [[Wanted!]] page on the quest list in-game.

Killing the [[Black Knight (Port Sarim Jail)|Black Knight]] imprisoned in the [[Port Sarim Jail]] will not contribute to a player's White Knight rank.

==Knight rankings==
In order to increase your ranking and unlock equipment items, you must kill a certain number of [[Black Knight]]s. The kills start being tracked after being deputised as a White Knight during the [[Wanted!]] quest, and 100 kills are received as a bonus for completing the quest.{{CiteTwitter|author=Mod Ash|url=https://twitter.com/JagexAsh/status/1290051534538059776|date=2 August 2020|archiveurl=https://archive.is/B74zS|archivedate=3 August 2020|quote=It starts counting once you reach the bit of the quest where the QJ says "I should go and speak to Sir Tiffy for advice on finding this Solus character..." And you get a +100 bonus on it at the end of the quest.}} Killing [[White Knight|White Knights]] decreases the player's ranking by 1 per knight killed.
